intro: Genetyllis drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's filaree, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small annual herb with delicate, feathery foliage and produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils in open areas such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and slender, branching stems. It is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions.
